title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central Functional Consultant
description: As a Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central Functional Consultant, you will have the opportunity to work with a reputable Microsoft Gold Partner, delivering innovative business solutions to clients across various industries. Leveraging your expertise in Dynamics 365 Business Central, you will play a key role in implementing customized solutions that meet clients' specific business requirements.
responsibilities: Collaborate with clients to gather and analyze business requirements.
Design and configure Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central solutions to address client needs.
Provide expert guidance and support throughout the implementation process.
Conduct user training and workshops to ensure successful adoption of the Microsoft D365 Business Central solution.
Work closely with project managers, developers, and other stakeholders to deliver projects on time and within budget.
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field (desirable).
Minimum of 3 years of experience implementing and customizing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.
Strong understanding of finance, accounting, supply chain, and/or manufacturing processes.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with clients and colleagues.
Microsoft Dynamics 365 certifications (e.g., MB-800, MB-700) preferred.

title: Business Central Finance Specialist
description: Dynamics NAV/D365 Business Central Consultant. My client is currently recruiting for a leading Microsoft Dynamics NAV/D365 BC Partner based within Sweden. The company are interested in adding to their team with an experienced Consultant within Dynamics NAV/D365 Business Central.
responsibilities: Working on full life cycle Dynamics NAV / D365 Business Central Projects.
Work with other consultants in a Microsoft partner environment.
Working on Dynamics NAV/D365 Business Central projects.
Implement Dynamics BC
qualifications: Experience with Dynamics NAV / D365 Business Central, from NAV 2009 to Dynamics NAV/D365 Business Central.
Excellent Consultancy experience within the Dynamics channel.
Consultancy experience is beneficial.
Finance & implementation experience is required

title: Dynamics Business Central - Developer
description:
Senior Dynamics 365 Business Central Developer
Up to £70k + Benefits | Remote or Hybrid | UK-Based
My client is a fast-growing Microsoft Partner looking to bring on board a Senior Business Central Developer to play a key role in delivering high-quality customisations and technical solutions across a range of BC projects. You'll work closely with functional consultants and the wider technical team to build scalable, reliable and high-performing solutions for clients across multiple industries.
benefits: Flexible working - fully remote or hybrid
Clear progression pathway into Lead Developer or Technical Architect roles
Supportive team culture with regular knowledge sharing and development opportunities
responsibilities: Design, develop and implement custom solutions within Dynamics 365 Business Central (AL and C/AL)
Lead the technical development of end-to-end BC implementation and upgrade projects
Build and maintain extensions, integrations and custom modules to meet client-specific needs
Collaborate with functional consultants to translate requirements into robust technical specifications
Upgrade legacy NAV systems to Business Central, ensuring minimal disruption and improved functionality
Optimise performance and ensure code quality through testing, peer reviews and best practice development
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for deployed solutions post go-live
Keep up to date with the latest BC features, tools and development practices
Mentor junior developers and contribute to internal development standards
qualifications: Strong hands-on development experience with Dynamics NAV and Business Central (AL and C/AL)
Proven experience working in a Microsoft Partner or consultancy environment
Solid understanding of Business Central architecture and best practice coding standards
Experience with API integrations, web services and extensions
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams

title: Lead Dynamics 365 Business Central Consultant - Remote
description: Join a dynamic team dedicated to delivering exceptional solutions. We are seeking a Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central Functional Consultant to join our client's team. This is a permanent role based in the USA, offering the opportunity to work remotely with approximately 25% travel. The ideal candidate will play a vital role in enhancing business processes and implementing innovative solutions using Dynamics 365 Business Central for varied clients.
responsibilities: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into Business Central functionality
Provide expert insight into Dynamics 365 Business Central best practices to drive project success.
Support system integrations and customizations to optimize workflow efficiency.
Train and assist end-users on system functionalities, ensuring smooth adoption.
Stay updated on Dynamics 365 Business Central developments to drive continuous improvement.
Configure, map, and test EDI transactions (X12, EDIFACT, XML, etc.) for smooth data flow

title: Dynamics Business Central - Functional Consultant
description:
Functional Dynamics 365 Business Central Consultant
Up to £70k + Benefits | Remote or Hybrid | UK-Based
My client is a growing Microsoft Partner seeking an experienced Dynamics 365 Business Central Functional Consultant to join their team. This is a fantastic opportunity to take ownership of full-cycle BC implementations and upgrades while playing a key role in the company's continued growth.
benefits: Clear career progression with opportunities to grow into leadership or solution architect roles
Flexible working model - remote or hybrid depending on preference
responsibilities: Lead full end-to-end Dynamics 365 Business Central implementation projects from discovery to go-live
Run client discovery sessions to gather and document business requirements
Translate client needs into functional BC solutions and create detailed scoping and specification documents
Configure Business Central to align with client business processes including workflows, financials, reporting and integrations
Deliver tailored training sessions to end users and key stakeholders across departments
Support clients through go-live, troubleshooting issues and ensuring a smooth transition
Provide ongoing post-implementation support, including issue resolution, system optimisation and process improvements
Collaborate with internal development teams to ensure customisations align with project goals and user expectations
Participate in upgrade projects from older NAV versions to the latest BC releases
qualifications: Strong background in Dynamics NAV and Dynamics 365 Business Central
Experience delivering solutions in a Microsoft Partner environment
Broad functional knowledge of all BC modules with a particular strength in Finance
Confident working with end users and stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver training
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines effectively

title: D365 F&O Business Systems Analyst
description: We are working with an established manufacturing company on a full-time role, as they seek a specialist D365 F&O Business Systems Analyst to take ownership of maintaining and implementing features to their current ERP system. You will be collaborating with stakeholders on systems improvement whilst analysing business requirements, producing reporting solutions, and leading technology initiatives.
responsibilities: Build a thorough understanding of business workflows and how they integrate with Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O) and ISV solutions.
Deliver user training and coaching on D365 and ISV functional tasks, emphasizing standardized and best-practice business processes.
Administer and adjust system-wide D365 settings to accommodate evolving business requirements and support organisational growth.
Analyze business needs and translate them into system specifications, recommending optimal F&O functionality with a focus on low-code/no-code approaches.
qualifications: A bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related discipline is preferred.
Minimum of 5 years' experience providing ERP support within a manufacturing setting.
At least 3 years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations, including implementation and functional support.
Formal training and professional certifications are highly desirable.
Familiarity with the Lean Manufacturing module in Dynamics AX 2012 or D365 F&O is preferred.
Strong grasp of core business processes across manufacturing operations, including Order to Cash, Concept to Market, Procure to Pay, Pick to Ship, Plan to Production, and Post to Close.
Prior exposure to EDI and PLM systems is advantageous.

title: Power Platform Developer
description:
Power Platform Developer - London - £35K - £50K. Nigel Frank have been retained by a South London based organisation wanting to build out their systems using power platform. This position offers the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, integrating technology to improve business operations and enhance user experience. This is a remote role but looking for someone with flexibility that if needed would be able to get to the office.

Your Role & Responsibilities:
- Configure Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform apps to align with evolving business requirements.
- Develop and maintain model-driven Power Apps, ensuring smooth user interaction and scalability.
- Build and manage Power Pages (formerly Portals) for secure engagement with external audiences.
- Leverage Microsoft Customer Insights to enable effective customer segmentation, penalisation, and analytics.
- Design automated work flows using Power Automate to streamline processes and improve efficiency.
- Connect Dynamics 365 with other Microsoft services such as SharePoint, Teams, and Outlook.
- Manage Dataverse configurations including entities, forms, views, relationships, and rules.
responsibilities: Configure Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform apps to align with evolving business requirements.
Develop and maintain model-driven Power Apps, ensuring smooth user interaction and scalability.
Build and manage Power Pages (formerly Portals) for secure engagement with external audiences.
Leverage Microsoft Customer Insights to enable effective customer segmentation, penalisation, and analytics.
Design automated workflows using Power Automate to streamline processes and improve efficiency.
Connect Dynamics 365 with other Microsoft services such as SharePoint, Teams, and Outlook.
Manage Dataverse configurations including entities, forms, views, relationships, and rules.
qualifications: Demonstrated experience with Dynamics 365 CRM development and the Microsoft Power Platform.
Strong skills in Power Apps (model-driven), Dataverse, and Power Pages.
Practical experience using Microsoft Customer Insights for campaigns and analytics.
Solid understanding of Power Automate, JavaScript, and portal development using HTML/CSS and Liquid.
Proficiency in customising workflows, forms, plugins, and business process flows.
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 integrations and cross-platform connectivity.
Strong communication skills with the ability to work independently in a remote environment.
